Recap: Nora returns to the Buchanan mansion and lets Clint and Dorian know what happened at Lindsay's arraignment. Cris comes home and lets Sarah know that Lindsay suffered an emotional meltdown at her arraignment hearing. Angrily, Jared tells Natalie and Nash that it doesn't matter who Jessica claimed to be when she him sent to prison. Cole consoles Starr and assures her that this matter with Tommy will resolve itself in time. Sarah offers Cris sympathy as he wishes that he could help Lindsay in this sticky situation. Jessica explains to Jared that she suffers from multiple personality disorder. Dorian points the finger of blame at Nora for her involvement in this situation. Rex blames himself for Lindsay's meltdown. Insisting that Jessica pay for what she did to him, Jared tries to force Natalie to give him a position at Buchanan Enterprises. Nora suggests to Dorian that Lindsay may have pulled a fast one in order to get out of standing trial for murdering Spencer Truman. Natalie challenges Jared to a game of pool to determine if he gets the job at Buchanan Enterprises (B.E.). Markko mentions to Cole and Starr his concerns about Langston having so little contact with her parents. Jared defeats Natalie at her own game and requests the corner office at B.E.
Transcript: Clint: No -- oh, no --
Dorian: Come on, come on, come on, give it to me.
Clint: Dorian -- I know what you're doing.
Dorian: Yes. One word -- "Casablanca."
Clint: The game.
Dorian: No, no, no, old movie. A classic, so romantic.
Clint: I'll tell you how it ends. I'm going to watch the game.
Dorian: Oh, stop it! No! I won't let you.
Clint: Oh, Nora! Nora, thank God you're here. You want to watch the game, too, don't you?
[Nora slams down briefcase]
Clint: Nora, what is it?
Dorian: Nora, what's wrong?
Nora: Honestly, you -- you just had to see it to believe it.

[Music plays]

Sarah: Oh. I take it-- it didn't go well?
Cristian: She didn't get bail. And she pleaded guilty.
Sarah: Why would she do that?
Cristian: I don't know. But afterwards, she had a breakdown.

Adriana: We should talk about it.

Adriana: I'm so sorry, Rex.

Rex: Feeling guilty is one thing. Pleading guilty to first-degree murder is some kind of death wish.

Langston: Markko? Markko! Markko!

Starr: Cole, I told you already, it's no big deal.

Cole: You are awesome. I love you -- it -- you -- both.
[Langston laughs]
Starr: Well, I'm very glad.

Starr: Jack, you better be sleeping! Don't make me come up there!

Natalie: I cannot believe I'm hearing this.

Jared: Does it really matter what she was calling herself? She put me in prison for two years, because of her. I spent a lot time thinking of how I was going to find her when I got out, and so here I am.
Jessica: How did you find me?
Inmate: Want a book, Mr. Breaking and entering?
[Jared sighs]
Jared: I'm innocent.
[Inmate laughs]
Inmate: Yeah, that's what they all say.
Jared: Yeah, well, in this case, it's true. I was set up by some sneaky little bitch.
Inmate: Let me guess. And the cops couldn't find her? You want a book or not?
Jared: Someone's sending me a message. This guy's my idol.
Inmate: Asa Buchanan?
Jared: I'm going to be as rich as him someday. Richer. I'm going to have everything he has, and more.
Jared: Talk about a message -- there's the sneaky little bitch herself. And now it's payback time for poor little rich girl Jess, alias Tess.
Nash: All right. You're not listening. See, Jessica wasn't faking it. She wasn't using any alias. She was literally another person.

Clint: So Lindsay pled guilty and then she just fell apart?

Nora: Huh. Well, apparently, no one saw it coming.

Sarah: When you say Lindsay had a breakdown, what do you mean by that?

Cristian: They took her to St. Ann's.

Jared: An -- an evil twin? Are you kidding me?
Natalie: Does she look like she's kidding? Do any of us look like we're kidding?
Jared: A split personality? That's good. Well, unfortunately for you, baby cakes, it wasn't my evil twin that you had thrown in the can.
Jessica: I know it's hard for you to believe --
Jared: It's not hard, it's impossible.
Natalie: Well, it's true.
Jared: What -- this is good. She comes up with a load of crap, and you two back her up. Why can't I believe it?
Nash: I -- I had a hard time believing it myself at first. It is true, and we can prove it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Starr: Um -- are you hungry? I'm going to go get us some popcorn.

Cole: Starr, all right -- relax. Listen, your baby brother's going to come home. All right? I mean, he's blood family. There's no way a judge will send him to somebody else. It's all going to work out, ok?
Starr: Not for everyone, Cole. Mrs. McBain loves Tommy, and -- oh, and it's just so hard for me to even call him Tommy. I fell terrible, like we're kidnapping him or something.
Cole: Oh, come on, that doesn't make any sense.
Starr: I know, but Mrs. McBain was always there for us, Cole. Even when we weren't allowed to be together, she always understood.
Cole: Yeah, well, she's cool like that.

Starr: I know, and now I'm expected to hate her because my parents do. It's not fair her kid should be taken away because of Spencer Truman and I'm not allowed to feel sorry for her. But he's my brother and she shouldn't have him, but -- god, it's not her fault, and I don't even know what to think about this situation. It's just so confusing.
Cole: Whew. Yeah, it totally sucks. But it's nobody's fault. I wish there was something I could say to make you feel better, but --

Starr: But you can't. Because once this custody battle is over between my dad and the McBains, somebody's going to lose and somebody's going to be really hurt. And knowing my dad and Mrs. McBain, they may never get over it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sarah: I can tell this is really hard on you. Is there anything I can do?
Cristian: I wish there was. I wish there was something I could do for Lindsay, but you know what? It's too late.
Sarah: Hey, it's never too late to do some
Cristian: I can't believe she was holding on to that secret for months and I didn't know about it. I should've known there was something wrong.
Sarah: Cristian, you can't blame yourself for things you can't control.

Cristian: She was always there for me, Sarah. I should have been there for her. You know, there was a time when I -- when I thought I'd never paint again, and Lindsay -- she didn't give up on me. She told me to keep trying, keep pushing myself. I wasn't very nice about it at the time, but it got me painting again, it got me taking pictures. If it weren't for Lindsay and Evangeline, I don't think I would have ever picked up a brush again.
Sarah: What happened with Lindsay and Evangeline -- that was just tough luck. You know that. You shouldn't feel bad about it.
Cristian: Feel bad? Feel bad? I'm upset, Sarah. I'm upset. I'm pissed off. I'm scared for her.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nigel: I just heard the ghastly news about Ms. Rappaport on the radio. I thought perhaps you could all use something to drink.
Clint: Thank you, Nigel.
Nigel: No need for a thank-you, sir.
Nora: I'll have mine stemmed up with olives.
Clint: And I'll have my usual.
Dorian: Just sparkling water for me, Nigel.
Nora: What? Oh, Dorian, please, it's the end of a -- just a miserable day. I deserve a drink. I just watched a woman fall apart in front of my eyes.
Clint: It was that bad?
Nora: It was ghastly, Clint. It was terrible. The worst part was Will's face.
Clint: Will? I didn't even know will was in town.
Nora: Yeah, he came in to support her, and, my God, it was just -- oh. He was just destroyed, you know? As if he hadn't been put through enough already.
Dorian: And what's that supposed to mean?
Nora: Excuse me?
Dorian: The way you said that -- as if he hasn't been through enough already. As if this was all Lindsay's fault.
Nora: Oh, no, why would you ever say that?
Dorian: Because if this was anybody's fault, Nora -- thank you, Nigel -- it's yours.
Nora: Oh. Thank you, Nigel.

Adriana: I think I understand. It was because of Jen, wasn't it?

Rex: Nora is a good district attorney. No, no, I -- I take that back. She's a great attorney, but I still know that Lindsay could have beaten this.

Rex: Yeah, but that's crazy.

Adriana: And I think she could have gotten away with it. So do you.
Rex: Yeah, I do. She just couldn't live with the guilt factor.

Adriana: Is she going to be ok?
Rex: No. Lindsay's got a huge heart. This time, she just looked broken.
Adriana: Michael and Marcie must be going through hell. I mean, knowing now what Lindsay did for them --
Rex: It's all moot now, isn't it? What a waste. Lindsay's life is ruined, and Todd's going to get Tommy.
Adriana: Lindsay did it for nothing.

Adriana: We already know that.
Rex: No, I mean -- for everything.
Adriana: Who?
Rex: Me.

Nora: Wait a minute. You're saying that Lindsay's meltdown was my fault?

Nora: Well, what? Let her go? Look the other way?
Dorian: You did not have to go after her the way you did.
